thread.title: Hunter Willis propels Greenback to region title - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Hunter Willis propels Greenback to region title - PrepXtra Story

author: John Shearer
title: Hunter Willis propels Greenback to region title - PrepXtra
text:
HARRIMAN â€” Greenback and Harriman high schools entered Friday night's game with identical records atop Region 2-1A.
They also found themselves with identical fourth-and-goal plays from the 1-yard line in the first quarter.
Greenback was able to convert its attempt into a touchdown on a quarterback sneak by Hunter Willis. Host Harriman could not convert its opportunity into points.
That told the tale of what would follow as Greenback captured the region title with a 49-28 victory.
Willis passed for 266 yards in the first half and had three touchdown passes to T.J. Jones that covered 38, 53 and 65 yards to put the Cherokees (7-2, 5-0) up 28-0 at the break.
Willis also had a 10-yard scoring strike to Kayne Roberts in the third quarter and a 36-yard touchdown pass to Jones late in the fourth.
"Tonight we knew with some injuries we were going to have to step back and throw the ball, and I just wanted to do the best I could," said Willis.
His coach, Brent Kilpatrick, was pleased with Willis' breakout performance.
"He has not really gotten the credit he deserves," he said.
For Harriman (6-3, 4-1), which still will host a first-round playoff game, the storyline was missed scoring opportunities.
The Blue Devils were stopped near the Greenback goal two additional times before finally scoring on a 3-yard TD run by T.J. Phipps in the third quarter.
They rallied somewhat with three fourth-quarter touchdowns on short runs by Joe Joe Luna and Joe Pace, and a 17-yard TD pass from Pace to Bobby Jackson.
"I'm proud of my kids for fighting back," said Harriman coach Travis Tapp.
In the first quarter, the game was delayed for about 10 minutes when Greenback lineman Michael Thacker had to be taken off the field on a cart following a leg injury that he suffered several plays earlier.
John Shearer is a freelance contributor.
